effects: Thickets form labyrinthine passages within 1 mile of the lair, causing creatures to become lost. Navigation checks in the area have disadvantage.
The roots and vines within 1 mile of the lair grow rapidly and can grapple intruders; creatures must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be Restrained.
Fog obscures the forest within 6 miles of the lair, making the area lightly obscured at all times.
Trees within 3 miles lean away from pathways, creating natural corridors that guide visitors to the treant.
Animals within 3 miles act as sentinels, alerting the treant to intruders.
The forest floor within 3 miles is free of undergrowth, making travel easy for those the treant approves of, but overgrown and impassable for those it does not.

naturalHazards.name: Falling Trees
naturalHazards.description: Strong winds or rotting trunks can cause trees to fall. A creature in the path of a falling tree must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d6 bludgeoning damage on a failure and being knocked Prone, or half damage on a success.

naturalHazards.name: Dense Undergrowth
naturalHazards.description: Heavy undergrowth functions as difficult terrain. Creatures moving through dense undergrowth cannot use the Dash action unless they have a feature that allows movement through nonmagical plants.

naturalHazards.name: Forest Fire
naturalHazards.description: A forest fire spreads 1d4 x 100 feet per round with the wind. Creatures in the fire take 2d6 fire damage at the start of each turn. Smoke creates a heavily obscured area extending 2d4 x 100 feet from the fire's edge. Creatures in smoke must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or spend their action coughing.

naturalHazards.name: Poisonous Flora
naturalHazards.description: Certain plants release toxic spores or have poisonous thorns. A creature that touches or disturbs such a plant must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be Poisoned for 1 hour.
